dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Really?  I'm partial to the skunks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Finally the doors open and they exit to a hail, enter ano doors.  Now they are in

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It looks more like a bizarre industrial kitchen than anyt Deep stainless steel tanks line one wall.  On the ceiling tanks hang massive pulleys and grappling hooks for the la carcasses.  In a far corner of the workshop is a stainles bearing a DEAD GORILLA.  A pink faced eighty year old man the carcass with sharp tools.  This is DON OSTERBAAN.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did you ever wonder where we get all our skeletons?  This is the laboratory where animal carcasses are reduced to bones. (to Osterbaan) What's cooking today, Don?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Zebra.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Frock looks into a large maceration tank with Pendergast A zebra carcass can be seen under the muddy surface, its soft tissues falling off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Man, that's ripe.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Frock now opens the door on a humid closet adjacent to th Inside on a stainless steel table lies the corpse of a fo crawling with BLACK BEETLES which are devouring it.  D'Ag Pendergast watch the grizzly scene, properly impressed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dermestid beetles.  The second method of preparing a skeleton, used in Natural History Museums world wide. Bugs are clean and highly efficient. They'll polish that fox off in no time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Don casually peels back the gorilla's whole face expos skull...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Want to have a look at a gorilla brain?  Got one right here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thanks Don.  We're in a hurry.  Some other time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: More rows of stainless steel doors under hissing steam pi light is dim here, and several bulbs are burned out.  But on the storage rooms are much higher now.  The three men the darkness.  Frock rounds a last corner and wheels to a

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This should be it.  Can you read the number?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pendergast reaches up above them and TAPS THE LIGHT BULB. and they all see the heavy steel door of the storage area jaw drops and his toothpick falls out.  The door has been top to bottom by long, vicious, CLAWS!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Holy shit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Frock stares in amazement, shaken.  He runs a finger down ruts.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Something tried to get into this room!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And failed.  These doors are solid steel.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This means there must be an animal loose in the museum!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I wouldn't be so sure.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pendergast takes Frock's keys and opens the door.  It swi oiled hinges.  D'Agosta turns on a light.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They all enter.  Nothing has been disturbed.  The crates middle of the small room, untouched.  Pendergast kneels b that's been opened.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This must be the one that held the statue.  Let's see what else is inside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pendergast removes the lid and hands it to D'Agosta, pull DART GUN, SEED PODS, a CARVED STONE.  D'Agosta takes the it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The lid of this crate is scratched with claw marks, just like the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As D'Agosta studies the lid, a brittle, water damaged env out.  D'Agosta picks it up.  The envelope bears an imprin ARROWS, one silver overlaid with another of GOLD.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look.  It's some kind of letter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (excited) May I see that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: D'Agosta hands the letter to Frock.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's from John.  Those two arrows were his insignia.  It's addressed to Louis Moriarty, a patron who financed his expeditions.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Read it out loud.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "Dear Louis, Tomorrow we go to the south end of the tepui where we'll be in the greatest danger, so I'm sending Carlos back with the crates.  You always believed in me, Louis, even in the darkest days.  So it gives me great pleasure to tell you your faith has been rewarded.  We've made an incredible find.  I enclose a representation of Mbwun.  Note the exaggerated claws, the reptilian attributes, the hints of bipedalia. It's beyond belief, but this statue is accurate.  I know because I've seen the beast."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Frock stops, looks up at D'Agosta and Pendergast.  His fa with the thrill.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did you hear that?  My God.  He says that Mbwun is real!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (snorts) Pardon my French, but bull shit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This on top of the scratches... isn't it proof!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think the scratches were put there to scare us.  Perhaps even lead us to this note.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pendergast looks out to the dark corridors.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You said John Whittlesley made a study of your blueprints of the museum.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are there any hidden rooms or staircases?  Places where someone could hide?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not really.  Just the sub-basement.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: D'Agosta and Pendergast exchange a look.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where is that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know.  It was walled over.  No one's been down there in years.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You said you had plans of the museum.  Could we see them, please?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A series of boxes labeled "PROFESSOR FROCK" sit on the lo small moving van, partially loaded with the contents of F office, sits waiting.  Frock delves through one of the bo Pendergast and D'Agosta look on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know they're here somewhere.  It's a good thing we caught the movers in time.  They're nineteen century blueprints from when the museum was built.  I remember the sub-basement was below the regular basement, linked to the city sewer.  I only know about it because it flooded all the way up to the museum during the hurricane of '49.  I lost so many precious books.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Frock continues to unload boxes, scattering things right It's the most amazing assortment of paraphernalia.  A col wildflowers, soil samples, a stuffed owl.  Finally he pul very old blueprints and flashes a triumphant smile.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eureka.  Who says it doesn't pay to be a pack rat?  Now please be careful with these.  When you're done, I'd like them back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Visitors scatter as Pendergast enters with D'Agosta, TWO dog handler, JONATHAN HAMM and Jonathan's pair of HUGE BL The deputies are armed with large shotguns.  Pendergast s blueprints as they walk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How big is the sub-basement?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Apparently it's huge.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think I should come with you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We haven't got time.  You have to meet with museum security so we can make a decision about tonight.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pendergast, Jonathan, his dogs and the deputies make thei industrial set of stairs into the basement.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In a moment they arrive at the site of Beauregard's murde at the bottom of the spiral stairway is still littered wi crime tape, spray paint and the remains of scores of peop in and out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: These plans indicate there's a walled over entrance to the sub- basement right around here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They move carefully down the dark corridor which we remem time we last saw it with Henry and Larry.  Unknown to Jon Pendergast, the dogs are walking directly towards the spo boys faced the monster.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The dogs are picking up something, Mr. Pendergast.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The dogs start barking in animation, sniffing the wall. studies the blueprints with a flashlight, moves to the sp nothing to be seen.  He shines his flashlight over the wa uneven stucco between two steel beams.  The dogs sniff fu point where the wall meets the floor.  Pendergast moves h the joint between the stucco and the beam, shoves hard. pushes back.  It's a door!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They enter a dank stairwell with brick stairs.  Water dri walls.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What is this?  A dungeon?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jonathan looks uneasy, double wraps the dogs' leashes aro black-gloved hands.  The two deputies remove their 12 gau shoulders.  Then they all follow the animals, descend dow stairwell.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The place looks like the control room of a nuclear power SECURITY GUARDS monitor a battery of closed-circuit scree is now accompanied by the pompous head of security, IPPOL Ippolito feels D'Agosta is pissing on his territory and h assert control.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This huge police presence tonight isn't necessary, Lieutenant.  You'll just scare people off.  I can handle the security behind scenes with this system.  It's state of the art.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The cops are non-negotiable, Ippolito.  Why don't you just tell me how this space station works.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's fool proof, basically.  I designed this whole thing myself. Every valuable object in the Museum carries a small electronic chip.  If anything's moved so much as an inch, we get an alarm pinpointing the exact location of the attempted theft.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's great if you're stopping a burglar.  Not our goal here.  Are there motion detectors?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In every exhibition room.  The museum's divided into five cells. The reception and exhibit are in cell five.  We could arm the motion detectors in cells one to four, then seal the perimeter with our fire doors.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That would leave one exit for hundreds of people.  You'd be violating every fire regulation on the books.  We'll guard the perimeter with my men and engage the motion detectors in the other cells.  One more question.  I see a big hole.  If this entire thing is run by computer, what happens if the power fails?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (snorts) You don't know much about computers, Lieutenant.  There are safeguards built in.  We have back-up systems with redundancies.  There's no way these computers can fail.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Margo, Kawakita and Frock are studying the contents of th

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can't help thinking there's something that Pendergast overlooked.  If the scratches were made by whatever killed Beauregard, it wants something that's in here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A blow dart.  Seed pods.  A plant press.  Pretty unimpressive stuff.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let me see the plant press.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Frock opens the plant press and sees a specimen inside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What is it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not sure.  As you know, the Kothoga lived outside civilization on the tepui for thousands of years. Species flourished in isolation when man and pollution rendered them extinct.  This could be one of the last remaining samples of an unknown plant.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Whatever it is, it must be common on the tepui.  John used it as packing material.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're right.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kawakita lifts out a bit of the fibers, as does Frock.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They're curiously fleshy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And they smell delicious.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kawakita TAKES a NIBBLE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Taste great.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I wouldn't put that in your mouth until we do a chemical analysis, Greg.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can handle that for you while we're waiting on the G.S.E.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kawakita rises and exits with some of the plant.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What about those seed pods?  Are they from the same plant?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Frock takes a moment to study them, looks up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Margo, these aren't seed pods.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are they?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They're eggs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Black as night.  The only light comes from the men's flas They're at a crossroads.  Crooked corridors, with arched barely the height of a man stretch in several directions. crouched down, resting with the panting dogs.  The deputi a smoke.  They all look both uneasy and exhausted except Pendergast.  He stares at the blueprints.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hard to read in this light.  The ink is so faded.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The dogs have lost the scent, Mr. Pendergast.  Maybe we should head back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not yet.  Let's try the fork to the left.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The men reluctantly shoulder their shotguns and push on. walk ahead, carelessly nosing the ground.  The flashlight illuminate lime-encrusted, cave-like walls.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This place gives me the creeps.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: At this the dogs begin to WHINE.  The HAIR on their backs ridge.  Pendergast turns as a BREEZE stirs his clothes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They've got something.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Keep the light up.  I can't see.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The dogs strain and pull forward, sniffing the air ahead. raise up their shotguns as they all move deeper into the flashlight beams streak crazily in all directions, barely the gloom.  Suddenly the dogs break into a terrifying BAY bounces off the walls.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shut them up!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Heel Argo!  Hobbes!  Heel!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The dogs drag Jonathan forward, paying no attention, foam mouth.  Jonathan is now frightened.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They're going crazy!  I need help!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Too late.  As Jonathan tries to grab the collars, one of forward, and the leash slips through Jonathan's hands.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's loose!  Argo!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Argo BOLTS into the darkness.  The men start after the do the frantic barking which echoes farther and farther in t Pendergast is in the lead.  Suddenly he throws out his ar

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stop!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Holy mother, what is that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A goatish odor envelops them all.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Smells God-awful.  Like rotten meat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Argo!  Come!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Quiet!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A SCUFFLING sound of claws dragging on brick is heard fol ROAR.  The men all freeze.  The other dog leaps and twist excitement.  In the confusion it also breaks free!  It te first dog, disappearing into the darkness.  Now Jonathan

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No!  Hobbes!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The deputies are terrified, retreat.  The darkness is sti claustrophobic.  The flashlights are small help.  Penderg remains dead calm.  His voice is cool and commanding.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Forget the dogs.  You two, get back here.  Don't point that gun at me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The deputies regain control and follow Pendergast's order into position, pump their shotguns and aim them down the echoing darkness ahead of them, the barking falters and s There is a moment of silence, then a terrible, unearthly deputies quail, frozen in their tracks.  Jonathan leaps f

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Argo!  Hobbes!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get back!  Now!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: At that moment a SHAPE hurtles at them from the darkness! in terror.  There are two stunning BLASTS from the shotgu FLASHES of light accompanied by a deafening roar.  The ru and dies and there's an intense silence, followed by a so

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You shot my dog!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hobbes lies five feet from them, a black shadow of death. kneels by the dog, tears in his eyes.  Down the animals s

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My dog...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (stammers) He was coming right at me...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In the distance they can hear a terrified howl.  It's the hurt or frightened.  It's a pitiful sound.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let's get out of here!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not going anywhere!  Not without my dog!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pendergast grabs at Jonathan who slips from his grasp.  J back down the hallway calling desperately.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hobbes!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get back!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jonathan shakes his head no.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's something out there!  Let's go get it now!  That's why we came down here, isn't it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to the deputies) He's right.  Follow me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But the two deputies are terrified.  They cling to the wa backwards, sheer horror in their eyes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No way.  I say we get help.  A lot more guns.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm ordering you!  Cover me!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We'll cover you from here!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jonathan is disappearing in front of them.  Pendergast ha Grim faced, he pulls his Colt .45 Anaconda from a shoulde It's a narrow and evil-looking gun.  From a pocket comes 255 grain wadcutter and 147 grain FMJ flatnose ammunition up, goes after Jonathan, who's no longer in sight.  Pende down a long, sloping hallway into cavernous blackness ahe bottom Pendergast stops.  He has to stoop down as he goes archway and into...

dialogues.speaker: A VAST ARCHING ROOM...
dialogues.text: A dark stream of water runs between concrete walls with t off from all sides.  It appears to be part of the sewer s cowers in a corner.  Jonathan moves to his side.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look.  It's Hobbes!  He's all right.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on.  Let's get back to the others.  We can't leave them alone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's alright.  I can tell by the way the dog's acting that whatever was out there is gone.  What is this place?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not on the map.  Looks like it connects with the city sewer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pendergast calls back down the tunnel for the deputies.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're coming back!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The words go unanswered.  From the hall comes a loud REPO shotguns, blasting desperately.  Something flies up all a the sound echoes.  BATS! Pendergast and Jonathan shield themselves from the flurry wings.  Finally the animals settle and Pendergast and Jon a look.  The silence is filled by a soft RUMBLING SOUND. together, waiting.  Pendergast points his gun at the hall to the deputies.  A ridge of hair on the dog's back rises growls.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Identify yourself!  Who's there?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No answer.  The rumbling continues, growing louder.  Then appears.  It comes rolling out of the hallway, bounces in and stops.  Pendergast shines his light on...  DEPUTY ONE'S HEAD!  The mouth is open wide in terror.  Ac is a vicious claw mark.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh... my... God!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (hisses) Quiet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And now they hear a GUT WRENCHING SHRIEK that's abruptly followed by a second rumbling sound!  Jonathan grabs Pend shirt, panicked.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stay calm.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They head quietly for the exit at the other end of room w slope up.  After they're gone a few moments the head of D rolls to a stop.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cabs and limousines tangle outside the west entrance.  A SPOTLIGHT is now turned on.  Elegantly dressed men in din and women in gowns rush to get out of the pelting rain, u jousting.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cuthbert's putting on his tux.  He adjusts the cummerbund happily as D'Agosta looks on.  D'Agosta paces, highly agi worried.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm telling you, something's wrong. I still haven't heard from Pendergast.  I think you should call it off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's too late now.  Guests are arriving.  The Mayor's car is pulling up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll go down and speak to him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (irritated) You haven't got the authority.  Only Pendergast can pull the plug.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pendergast may be in trouble.  Don't you understand?  He still hasn't come back.  It's been over three hours --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He'll be back.  Relax.  We're in good shape.  Your security is air tight. There've been no more incidents, nothing suspicious.  There's no reason to call off the opening now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Resounding with the echoes of several hundred expensive s the marble expanse and heading down the rows of palm tree the Hall of Heavens.  The palms themselves are festooned and violet lights.  Somewhere inside, an invisible band i York, New York".  An army of waiters in white tie thread through the guests carrying large silver platters crowded champagne glasses.  Cuthbert enters and crosses to meet T THE MAYOR'S WIFE.  Photographers step forward and flashbu

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Food is out.  Hundreds of tables are set with black linen Decorations have a dark, haunted house theme.  A hum of a up past the vast Corinthian columns into the circular dom

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: An explosive sneeze rattles the beakers and dislodges the specimens.  Margo interrupts her work at the computer to tissue as Frock looks on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What kind of egg is it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's reptilian.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Like the claw.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (cautious) Let's not jump to conclusions.  This egg could belong to any number of reptiles, Dr. Frock.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (excited) Come on, Margo.  We're on the verge of something huge.  Let's consider the possibility, just the three of us, alone in this room.  What if John was right.  I mean, what if?  And he sent back an egg of his monster in the crates.  When it got to the museum, it hatched.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Several problems with that theory. For one thing, this egg is intact. For another, according to Pendergast, the crates were shipped here on a boat.  Everyone on board was killed like Beauregard.  If the thing hatched in mid-ocean, where did it go?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Frock has no answer.  Greg gestures to his computer scree

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I guess you're not interested in this plant anymore, but the chemical analysis is done.  Frock reads the computer over Greg's shoulder.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "Genus: Unknown.  Family: Unknown. Order: Unknown.  Phylum: Unknown. Cripes, Margo, what did you give me? Is this an animal or one funky shrub?" (to Kawakita) I see you've been programming the computer vocabulary again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (points to a hexagonal symbol) Look at this.  An ambyloid reovirus protein.  That explains why the computer's confused.  The plant's infected with a virus.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's not so unusual.  Many plants carry viruses.  Like the burls on Maple trees.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But a virus normally codes for other viruses.  This one's making human and animal proteins.  Listen to this. (reads) "Glycotetraglycine collagenoid. Weinstein's tropic hormone.  4- monoxytocin supressin hormone."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: These plant fibers are loaded with hormones!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What kind of hormones?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kawakita pulls a heavy book from the shelf.  The Encyclop Biochemistry, thumbs to a page and reads.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 4-monoxytocin is... "A hormone secreted by the human hypothalamus gland."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Try Weinstein's tropic hormone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The tension is rising in the room.  Frock takes the book, one up, reads silently and removes his glasses.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A hormone secreted by the human thalamus gland.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kawakita and Frock look puzzled.  Margo rises in agitatio

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is it.  This is what he, or it... is after!  The plant has high concentrations of the same hormones found in minute quantities in the human brain!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So what?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pendergast told me the killer extracts and eats the hypothalamus and thalamus of the victim's brains!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (pales) Eats them?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes.  Whatever killed Beauregard may have lived on this plant.  When the crates were put in secure storage, they were out of reach.  The killer couldn't get them, so it got the next best thing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Beauregard's head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's a moment of stunned silence.  Then a LOUD BUZZER jump.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's all right.  That means the G.S.E.  has finished analyzing the claw DNA.  Greg, you go find Pendergast and Lieutenant D'Agosta now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kawakita tears up the dark stairs.  He turns a corner and JUMPS OUT at him.  He almost screams.  It's a DRUNK.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, where 'za little boys room?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Down that hallway.  But don't stay long.  You don't want to be here alone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Margo and Frock enter and huddle over a sheaf of papers t printer has spit out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All right, assuming the program is accurate, this is a description of the animal with that claw. (she reads) "Species unidentified.  Genus: unidentified.  Phylum unknown.  Male, weight in excess of 240 kg.  Brain capacity, 900 centimeters." That means it's highly intelligent. "Quadrupedal."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Quadrupedal!  The other name for Mbwun.  "He Who Walks on All Fours."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Margo and Frock exchange a look.  Holy shit.  Margo swall reading.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "Nocturnal.  External hair and bony plates.  Locomotor speed 60-70 kilometers.  Reduced optic chiasm"...  poor eyesight.  "External mucoid nasal glands,"... very keen scent...  "Morphological characteristics: Highly robust.  Aggressiveness: extreme."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So the claw came from a huge creature with a preternatural sense of smell and poor eyesight that hunts at night.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: With the intelligence of a human being, the speed of a greyhound, and the strength of a grizzly bear.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (a long moment) Margo, what you've just described is a killing machine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And it's hungry.  It's been two days since it's eaten.  There are five hundred people arriving right now. The animal hunts at night and it has a keen sense of smell!  All those people in one enclosed space...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's like ringing the dinner bell.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The crowd is now packed into the rotunda as the MAYOR cut ribbon across the entrance to the exhibit and everyone ap Cuthbert is by the mayor's side.  He steps forward and ra for quiet.  The crowd falls silent.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you everyone and welcome. We're glad all of you were willing to brave the inclement weather to be with us tonight.  Our special thanks to his honor, the mayor and his lovely wife.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Mayor takes a bow.  More applause.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Some people have questioned whether a superstition exhibit belongs in a Museum of Science.  Spells, incantations, demons, magic... these are forces that defy the natural laws.  Superstition provides answers to the great questions based on fear.  Science provides answers to the great questions based on truth. Science and superstition, then, are polar opposites.  Mortal enemies, if you will.  And that is why we are here tonight.  We have come to learn more about the enemy, and thus to bring about its defeat.  For every good, there is an evil, for every dark, a light.  And so tonight... my friends, I give you ignorance, terror, unreasoning fear, pure evil. dialogues.text: Margo closes her computer, looks out a window at the fall turns and walks into the back office.  Kawakita is workin His fly-fishing rod stands in the corner, untouched.  Mar smiles softly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No time for fishing anymore?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Greg looks up from his work and smiles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Got to finish this thesis sometime.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How about lunch?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not today.  Besides, I think the director of the museum is expecting you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Margo exits.  Greg returns to his work.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Margo heads down the hall to the Director's office.  She the new double oak doors to find DR. FROCK seated at Cuth desk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dr. Frock?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look who's here, Margo.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: PENDERGAST and D'AGOSTA rise out of two high-backed chair smiles for the first time, takes Pendergast's hands.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm so glad to see you.  What's the occasion?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm in town on a case.  Dropped by to see Vince and we thought we'd see the new display.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Margo, Pendergast, and D'Agosta follow Frock past the fam dioramas.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dr. Frock, I was wondering.  What happened to the rest of Whittlesley's plants?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They were sent to the Center For Disease Control in Atlanta.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shouldn't a drug that powerful be destroyed?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The virus itself might have positive applications.  They'll keep the plants in secure lock up while the studies are made. (beat) Greg isn't joining us?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's changed.  He's always working on his thesis.  He comes in early, stays late.  I tried to get him to join us, but he never takes a break.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They pause on a NEW DIORAMA.  It's huge, filling one enti hall.  In the center is a life-sized representation of MB on the tepui amid the plants.  Behind is a painting of Jo as he once was.  He wears the necklace with the two arrow and gold.  As Margo looks, she touches her own.  Penderga her, sympathy in his eyes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We did the right thing, Margo.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Margo smiles warmly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes.  I know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Greg Kawakita wears gloves, high powered glasses, works i the lab.  Suddenly he stands up, throws off the glasses, down again.  He seems to be struggling with himself.  He his shoulder to make sure he's alone.  Quickly he moves t drawer.  He opens it with a key from his pocket and takes envelope, looks inside. INSERT... the envelope is full of the PLANT FIBERS!  Greg keep his own cache! Moving quickly, with jerky motions, he lays one fiber dow with a shaking hand.  With an exacto knife, he cuts off a pops it into his mouth.  He closes his eyes in ecstasy an taste.  Then he cuts one more infinitesimal sliver, leave slide.  He takes a deep breath, returns the envelope to t turns the key carefully and we GO CLOSE ON HIS HAND...  On the back is A ROW OF SCALES...
